TopicTitle: The scary rain outside my house!

Articles.Content:
At my house its 18:43 and this is PenguinsMeep Reporting live!

There is the biggest raincloud i have ever seen in my life. Its hanging above me. I see a weather balloon outside rising in the could. ERMARGERD ITS A HURRRICANE!!!!!!! (well i think so )

Ok im clam. Its raining so much that i cant see anything out of my window. And the wind is bulging my windows! Im not kidding!
Ugh... Its starting to hail. Wind+Hail=Ice bullets
Whew... The rain ended I was kinda scared that my windows would break.

you're clam?

yummy. ima eat you now.

Pffff...that storm was nothing.

Down here in Texas especially during hurricane season we deal with water flooding the streets, water seeping into the house, power outages, flying debris ect.

Pffff...that storm was nothing.

Down here in Texas especially during hurricane season we deal with water flooding the streets, water seeping into the house, power outages, flying debris ect.

Yeah I'm also from Texas and get a lot of rain. One time after a storm my friends dad went fishing in the high school parking lot, AND CAUGHT A CRAWFISH.
There was a time i my town in California was hit by hurricane type winds that ranged from 60-90 MPH.Lets say that there are less trees.

There was a time my house got hit by a hurricane.

There was also this other time my house got hit by a hurricane.

There was also this other time my house got hit by a tree... during a hurricane.
Possibly the remains of the storm a few days ago. Also, read the other pots, HOLY *CENSORED SO MUCH IT'S RUNNING INTO FREE SPEECH ISSUES*

I do recall, that while on a visit to China, a typhoon hit the city I was staying in. Some debris smashed a window open, but my grandparents patched it up. Power went out for a day, severe flooding, reports of several dozen killed came in from all over the city, etc.

But, the shame is, I slept through half of it, and the storm had moved some good 500 Miles by the time I woke up (Around noon.)

Oklahoma reporting.

High and dry, though the weather can be as hard to predict as a good game from EA.

you're clam?

yummy. ima eat you now.

That storm must make you cold, but you're sweating cause your'e scared. That's why he's clamy....

I remember the awful storm we had in Sweden a few years ago. We remained indoors while it rained, and only had the TV to entertain us. At one point, the lights flickered. It was awful. When it had passed the next day, we heard that an old tree had fallen down on the road to our neighbours, and that pushing it off of the road had taken five whole minutes. It was horrible.
Your storm is nothing compared to what's apparently just west of me!

Feels like 8786 F?

My god.

I had a big storm a week ago. 5 second power outage.

Really, the worst I get here in Canada is an hour of power outages. East side or West side, dosen't matter.
I love the UK for another reason. Not many bad storms. We get the occasional small thunderstorm but that's about it.
Yea... its when we get the big ones the power usally goes out for no more than an hour.
I honestly hope that is a typo...
we here in south England never have bad weather, cant remember the last time i had a proper thunderstorm.
Anyone remember Superstorm Sandy? *shudders* I had no power or internet for a week.

Anyone remember Superstorm Sandy? *shudders* I had no power or internet for a week.

My wife and I were in Port-Au-Prince when that storm first came through the tropics. We chased it back through Florida that Saturday. I've been on rollercoasters gentler than that flight. Landing in Miami in a 747 with 75 MPH crosswinds...just, this:

1:50 - 2:30. When I'm in the back of the airplane, I should not be looking at the runway we're supposed to be landing on. From my short conversation with the pilot after landing, he was an F-4 pilot in Vietnam and had actually heard of my dad. Never got his name, though.

But anyway, I live in southwest Missouri, so I've had my combat helmet on continuously for the past few weeks. Almost got flooded out yesterday, in fact.
Psht, those are like ALL my landings ALL the time in KSP.
There was a couple of tornado warnings a few days ago where I live. It almost started flooding, too.
